p: Mahata et al. ( 208) evaluated the cardanol activity extracted from A. occidentale cashew, and its derivatives against C. albicans. The best MIC values were obtained for 4-[(4-cardanyl)azo] benzoic acid (CABA) hydrogel derivatives (8 μg/mL), followed by Self-assembled CABA (16 ug/mL) and cardanol (64 μg/mL). Drastic damages (lysis) caused by products in the fungus's membrane and cell wall were observed using scanning electron microscopy, especially by the CABA compound.
